intro: Reichantha mejiana, commonly known as the Mejiana reichantha, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and ixora. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
